results.title: Trouble : Responses to physical and emotional abuse
results.brief_description: Animated Norwegian production aimed at preventing sexual abuse in young children. The documentary begins with notions of uncomplicated ‘trouble’, such as being scared of a dog or not cleaning your room. There is a bigger item on the agenda, sexual abuse, and the documentary moves onto the area in an open and frank way. There is a case study presented of a young girl who is sexually abused by her uncle. She describes what happens and how she feels. The solution to her trouble is telling someone, which is the message the film portrays- that telling someone will drive the trouble away. The documentary is confronting in a way which is appropriate to the subject matter and perhaps necessary for instructing children about abuse. A leaflet accompanies the video. No other production detail available.

results.title: Miracle in Milan = miracolo a Milano
results.creator_credit: Vittorio De Sica, Nino Misiano, De Sica Productions and l'E N I C
results.brief_description: Based on the book ‘Toto il Buono’, acclaimed director Vittorio De Sica has produced a captivating fable, co-written by long-time collaborator Cesare Zavattini, mixing his sometimes harsh reality with fantastic characters and events in an increasingly unreal setting. The main character Toto, himself a rescued foundling, is a philanthropist, determined to help his fellow man in the way he was helped by the woman who adopted him. Mingling De Sica’s trademark neo-realism, in this case the shameful treatment of displaced persons after the War, with whimsical fantasy, this film won Best Film award at the 1951 Cannes Film Festival. Italian language with English subtitles.

results.title: Good morning Babylon
results.creator_credit: Paolo Taviani, Vittorio Taviani, Giuliani De Negri, Films A2, Filmtre, MK2 Productions, Pressman Film Corporation and RA11
results.brief_description: The Taviani Brothers’ first English language film is a bitter-sweet and joyous celebration of the early days of Hollywood movie making. Based on a true story, the film is a piece of pure and thrilling cinema and features an acclaimed performance by Charles Dance as the legendary director D.W. Griffith. Two Tuscan stonemason brothers decide to leave Italy for the New World when their father’s firm becomes bankrupt. They travel to Hollywood and wangle their way onto the film set of Griffith. They fall in love and celebrate a double wedding, however war soon intervenes to threaten their happiness.

results.title: The Amazon awakens
results.creator_credit: Inter-American Affairs and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: The story of the Amazon River Basin; its history and exploration by early Spanish explorers; its industrial progress; the natural resources and vast riches of this region still awaiting discovery and exploitation.

results.title: The Face in the mirror ['I wonder']
results.brief_description: Shows how to sell at retail effectively by disclosing to the salesman how he appears in the eyes of prospective buyers. Demonstrates good methods by actual on-the-scene experiences of a skilled salesman who wonders why his own techniques sometimes fail. Follows a salesman on shopping expedition to demonstrate that basic selling techniques result in satisfied customers. Cast includes Ruth Mattison, James Kirkwood.

results.title: Hatari
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks, Malabar Productions and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Director Howard Hawks reteams with John Wayne, who heads a group of highly skilled professional game hunters in Africa. They don’t use bullets, rather capturing the ferocious big game with rope and cameras for zoos and circus attractions, an exciting business that pits man against beast. “Hatari” means “danger” in Swahili and the fine cast of this spectacular adventure film also includes Hardy Kruger, Red Buttons and Elsa Martinelli and Gerard Blain.

results.title: Feux follets
results.creator_credit: Jean-Claude Labrecque, Jacques Bobet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Les Feux Follets (Will-‘o-the-Wisps) was founded as an amateur dance group in Montreal and developed into a professional group whose repertoire represents the folklore and the ethnic origins of the Canadian people. Two dances illustrate the group’s virtuosity - a Plains Indian Betrothal dance, and a more frenetic exhibition of the sixties “go-go” dancing. Choreographed by Michel Cartier; music Claude Poirier; sound by Ron Alexander, Roger Lamoureux, Bernie Bordeleau and photographed and edited by Jean-Claude Labrecque.

results.title: Autism: who cares (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal, Horizontal Films and Victorian Autistic Children's Association
results.brief_description: Four centres for autistic children in Victoria show how they deal with this problem. Details how they are able to teach the children to eventually integrate into the community. Photographer: Leigh Tilson

results.title: Selling solidarity = Australian unionism in the '90's
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Best of Lateline”.
Australia has always had a strong union heritage. Peter Robson, (National President of the CPSU), and Peter Sams, (Secretary of the NSW Labour Council, discuss reasons for the rapidly declining membership and the ACTU’s multi-million dollar plan to recruit a new generation of workers.

results.title: Didjeridu: with Charlie McMahon
results.creator_credit: Jeni Kendell, Paul Tait and Gaia Films
results.brief_description: A journey with Charlie McMahon from the famed band “Gondwanaland” into the beautiful country of the Northern Territory. Accompanied by Aboriginal players and makers of the didjeridu, we see how the instruments are made and played by experts.
